problem.prob_desc:
26. 그림과 같이 곡선 $y=\sqrt{(1-2x)\cos x}\left(\dfrac{3\pi}{4}\le x\le \dfrac{5\pi}{4}\right)$와 $x$축 및 두 직선 $x = \dfrac{3}{4}\pi,\ x = \dfrac{5}{4}\pi$로 둘러싸인 부분을 밑면으로 하는 입체도형이 있다. 이 입체도형을 $x$축에 수직인 평면으로 자른 단면이 모두 정사각형일 때, 이 입체도형의 부피는? [3점]
① $\sqrt{2}\pi - \sqrt{2}$ ② $\sqrt{2}\pi - 1$ ③ $2\sqrt{2}\pi - \sqrt{2}$ ④ $2\sqrt{2}\pi - 1$ ⑤ $2\sqrt{2}\pi$

gpt-5-codex.title: Set up volume integral
gpt-5-codex.body: For x in [3π/4, 5π/4], each cross-section perpendicular to the x-axis is a square whose side length equals y. Since y = √((1−2x) cos x), the area of each square is y² = (1−2x) cos x. Hence the volume is V = ∫_{3π/4}^{5π/4} (1−2x) cos x dx.

gpt-5-codex.title: Integrate
gpt-5-codex.body: Compute ∫ (1−2x) cos x dx = sin x − 2∫ x cos x dx. Using integration by parts for ∫ x cos x dx (u = x, dv = cos x dx), we get ∫ x cos x dx = x sin x + cos x. Thus ∫ (1−2x) cos x dx = sin x − 2(x sin x + cos x) = sin x (1−2x) − 2 cos x.

gpt-5.title: Cross-section area
gpt-5.body: For each x in [3π/4, 5π/4], the square’s side equals the vertical length of the base: s(x) = y = sqrt((1−2x)cos x). So the cross-sectional area is A(x) = s(x)^2 = (1−2x)cos x.

gpt-5.title: Set up volume integral
gpt-5.body: Volume V = ∫_{3π/4}^{5π/4} A(x) dx = ∫_{3π/4}^{5π/4} (1−2x)cos x dx. An antiderivative is: ∫(1−2x)cos x dx = ∫cos x dx − 2∫x cos x dx = sin x − 2(x sin x + cos x).

claude-opus-4.5.title: Set up the volume integral
claude-opus-4.5.body: The cross-section perpendicular to the x-axis is a square with side length equal to y = √((1-2x)cos x). The area of each square cross-section is A(x) = y² = (1-2x)cos x. The volume is V = ∫[3π/4 to 5π/4] (1-2x)cos x dx

claude-opus-4.5.title: Apply integration by parts
claude-opus-4.5.body: Let u = 1-2x, dv = cos x dx. Then du = -2dx, v = sin x. Using integration by parts: ∫(1-2x)cos x dx = (1-2x)sin x - ∫(-2)sin x dx = (1-2x)sin x - 2cos x + C

gemini-3-pro.title: Set up the definite integral for volume
gemini-3-pro.body:
Since the cross-sections perpendicular to the x-axis are squares with side length $y$, the area of a cross-section is $S(x) = y^2 = (1-2x)\cos x$. The volume of the solid is the integral of $S(x)$ from $x = \frac{3\pi}{4}$ to $x = \frac{5\pi}{4}$:
\[ V = \int_{\frac{3\pi}{4}}^{\frac{5\pi}{4}} (1-2x)\cos x \, dx \]

gemini-3-pro.title: Apply integration by parts
gemini-3-pro.body:
Let $u = 1-2x$ and $dv = \cos x \, dx$. Then $du = -2 \, dx$ and $v = \sin x$. Applying the integration by parts formula $\int u \, dv = uv - \int v \, du$:
\[ V = \left[ (1-2x)\sin x \right]_{\frac{3\pi}{4}}^{\frac{5\pi}{4}} - \int_{\frac{3\pi}{4}}^{\frac{5\pi}{4}} \sin x (-2) \, dx \]
\[ V = \left[ (1-2x)\sin x \right]_{\frac{3\pi}{4}}^{\frac{5\pi}{4}} + 2 \int_{\frac{3\pi}{4}}^{\frac{5\pi}{4}} \sin x \, dx \]

gemini-3-pro.title: Evaluate the integral and compute final result
gemini-3-pro.body:
First, evaluate the boundary term:
At $x=\frac{5\pi}{4}$, $(1-\frac{5\pi}{2})(-\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}) = (\frac{5\pi}{2}-1)\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}$.
At $x=\frac{3\pi}{4}$, $(1-\frac{3\pi}{2})(\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2})$.
Difference: $\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}(\frac{5\pi}{2} - 1 - 1 + \frac{3\pi}{2}) = \frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}(4\pi - 2) = 2\sqrt{2}\pi - \sqrt{2}$.

Next, evaluate the integral term:
$2[-\cos x]_{\frac{3\pi}{4}}^{\frac{5\pi}{4}} = -2(\cos\frac{5\pi}{4} - \cos\frac{3\pi}{4}) = -2(-\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2} - (-\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2})) = 0$.

Total Volume $V = 2\sqrt{2}\pi - \sqrt{2}$.

grok-4-fast.title: Set up volume integral
grok-4-fast.body: The solid has square cross-sections perpendicular to the x-axis with side length y(x) = √[(1-2x) cos x] from x = 3π/4 to x = 5π/4. The area of each square is [y(x)]² = (1-2x) cos x. Thus, volume V = ∫_{3π/4}^{5π/4} (1-2x) cos x dx.

grok-4-fast.title: Integrate by parts
grok-4-fast.body: Compute ∫ (1-2x) cos x dx. Let u = 1-2x, dv = cos x dx; then du = -2 dx, v = sin x. ∫ u dv = uv - ∫ v du = (1-2x) sin x + 2 ∫ sin x dx = (1-2x) sin x - 2 cos x.
